channel.title: Graphics Card Help
channel.description:
Got my new PC, specs are:
GeForce6100SM-M mobo (Built in 256mb vid card (looking to change)) 2 GBs RAM 2.60 ghz processor 400w psu
I'm looking to get a [b]512mb[/b] vid card to replace my poor 256 in built one. Should be able to run most games on high, preferably. My price range goes up to about £130 or $260.
The 400w psu might be a problem for some demanding 512mb cards, but I know there are some decent ones that will work happily on my pc.
The graphic cards slots are as follows: 1 x PCI Express x16 slot (runs in x8 mode) 1 x PCI Express x1 slot
so the card has to have an interface that is one of the above.
Thanks :)

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

On another topic

well 8600 GTs are getting very cheap and they are really good, so i’d get one but they do use more power, if your cpu is single core it should function well though

Also the Dual 768MB NVIDIA® GeForce™ 8800 Ultra - SLI Enabled Is awesome thats what I’m getting!

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Bookmarked. Looks like a good one, for the price, and should run fine on my system <3

I get all my pc stuff from www.novatech.com, just bought a laptop too from them at a very nice price. Don’t know why i just find it the cheapest/best value for money there.

Keep searching in case you find a better one anyway!

Read full topic

Novatech

Novatech GeForce 8600GT SLI 512MB GDDR2 HDTV, VGA DVI/TVO PCI-E Graphics Card -...

Buy 8600GT 512MB Novatech GeForce 8600GT SLI 512MB GDDR2 HDTV, VGA DVI/TVO PCI-E Graphics Card Stockcode : NOV-86GT5 from Novatech

Sorry if its not what you are looking for… took me 2 seconds to find.

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Mr.Chris:

I’m running on a 256mb, 2.6ghz processor perfectly on 400w?

But your 256mb is an integrated card?

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I’m running on a 256mb, 2.6ghz processor perfectly on 400w?

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Mr.Chris:

My computer is pretty light weight. My system isn’t heavily laden, so it should be ok. You’re having a laugh at 650w. If needs be, I’ll replace my psu, but 400w is fine for a lightweight card.

I had problems running a 256mb card with a 1.8ghz processor on a 400w.

Trust me, you will want to upgrade your power supply.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

My computer is pretty light weight. My system isn’t heavily laden, so it should be ok. You’re having a laugh at 650w. If needs be, I’ll replace my psu, but 400w is fine for a lightweight card.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Help
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Mr.Chris:

The 400w psu is a problem for 512mb cards

*fixd

But seriously, even though 400w might be the “Minimum requirement” for some cards, that means “Minimum to successfully get past POST”. If you’re going to stress the card at all, like games, you’ll need at least 650w for your setup to run decently.

If you try to run that card under stress at 400w with that setup, you may actually damage the card.

Read full topic
